Let

d
⁢ d x

- 1
and

Math.text: (L _ n) ^ alpha * x = e ^ x * (x ^ (- alpha) / nfactorial) * D ^ n * e ^ (- x) * x ^ (n + alpha)

para.p:
called the Laguerre polynomials. Using the Leibniz rule for
⁢
D n
(
⋅ f g
)
yields

Math.text: (L _ n) ^ alpha * x = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ n)@(((Gamma * (n + alpha + 1)) / (Gamma * (k + alpha + 1))) * ((- x) ^ k / (kfactorial * (n - k)factorial)))

para.p: The generating function for the Laguerre polynomials is 1 footnote 1 1 footnote 1 N. N. Lebedev, Special Functions and Their Applications, p. 77, §4.17.

Math.text: formulae@(w * open-interval@(x, z) = (1 - z) ^ (- alpha - 1) * e ^ (- (x * z) / (1 - z)) = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@((L _ n) ^ alpha * x * z ^ n), absolute-value@(z) less 1)
formulae@(W * vector@(x, y, z) = (1 - z) ^ (- 1) * e ^ (- ((x + y) * z) / (1 - z)) * (x * y * z) ^ (- alpha / 2) * I _ alpha * ((2 * square-root@(x * y * z)) / (1 - z)), absolute-value@(z) less 1)
I _ alpha * x = i ^ (- alpha) * J _ alpha * i * x = ((sum _ (m = 0)) ^ infinity)@((1 / (mfactorial * Gamma * (m + alpha + 1))) * (x / 2) ^ (2 * m + alpha))
J _ alpha * x = ((sum _ (m = 0)) ^ infinity)@(((- 1) ^ m / (mfactorial * Gamma * (m + alpha + 1))) * (x / 2) ^ (2 * m + alpha))
W * vector@(x, y, z) = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(((nfactorial * (L _ n) ^ alpha * x * (L _ n) ^ alpha * y) / (Gamma * (n + alpha + 1))) * z ^ n)

para.p:
w
satisfies the ordinary differential equation

Math.text: (1 - z ^ 2) * (partial-differential _ z)@(w) + (x - (1 - z) * (1 + alpha)) * w = 0
(n + 1) * (L _ (n + 1)) ^ alpha * x + (x - alpha - 2 * n - 1) * (L _ n) ^ alpha * x + (n + alpha) * (L _ (n - 1)) ^ alpha * x = 0

para.p:
w
also satisfies the ordinary differential equation

Math.text: (1 - t) * (partial-differential _ x)@(w) + t * w = 0
(D * (L _ n) ^ alpha - D * (L _ (n - 1)) ^ alpha) + (L _ (n - 1)) ^ alpha = 0
formulae@(x * D * (L _ n) ^ alpha = n * (L _ n) ^ alpha - (n + alpha) * (L _ (n - 1)) ^ alpha, n >= 1)

Math.text: ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- a ^ 2 * x ^ 2) * J _ nu * b * x * x ^ (nu + 1) * differential-d@(x)) = (b ^ nu / (2 * a ^ 2) ^ (nu + 1)) * e ^ (- b ^ 2 / (4 * a ^ 2))

((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- t) * J _ (n + alpha) * 2 * square-root@(x * t) * (square-root@(x * t)) ^ (n + alpha) * differential-d@(t)) = e ^ (- x) * x ^ (n + alpha)

para.p: Now, it is a fact that

Math.text: (d / (d * u)) * u ^ (nu / 2) * J _ nu * 2 * square-root@(u) = u ^ ((nu - 1) / 2) * J _ (nu - 1) * 2 * square-root@(u)

para.p:

satisfies the differential equation

evaluated-at@(x * ((u _ n) ^ prime * u _ m - (u _ m) ^ prime * u _ n), 0, infinity) + (n - m) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(u _ m * u _ n * differential-d@(x)) = 0

(n * (L _ n) ^ alpha ^ 2 - (n + alpha) * (L _ (n - 1)) ^ alpha ^ 2 - (n + 1) * (L _ (n + 1)) ^ alpha * (L _ (n - 1)) ^ alpha) + 2 * (L _ n) ^ alpha * (L _ (n - 1)) ^ alpha + ((n + alpha) - 1) * (L _ n) ^ alpha * (L _ (n - 2)) ^ alpha = 0

n * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- x) * x ^ alpha * (L _ n) ^ alpha * x ^ 2 * differential-d@(x)) = (n + alpha) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- x) * x ^ alpha * (L _ (n - 1)) ^ alpha * x ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))

((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- x) * x ^ alpha * (L _ n) ^ alpha * x ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))

absent = (((n + alpha) * ((n + alpha) - 1) * cdots * (alpha + 2)) / ((n * (n - 2) * cdots * 3) cdot 2)) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- x) * x ^ alpha * (L _ 1) ^ alpha * x ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))
